meanings.definition: To make something resemble or conform to the characteristics of Prussia.
meanings.sent1: She tried to prussianise her wardrobe by adding military-style jackets.
meanings.sent2: The town decided to prussianise its architecture to match the historical buildings.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was to prussianise everything, leading to guests wearing Prussian-inspired outfits.
meanings.sent4: His strict rules prussianised the once laid-back atmosphere of the office.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes prussianised the painting, giving it a regal touch.

meanings.definition: To adopt or incorporate Prussian customs or practices.
meanings.sent1: The family decided to prussianise their holiday traditions by including a festive Prussian dance.
meanings.sent2: The school started to prussianise its curriculum by introducing Prussian history lessons.
meanings.sent3: The neighborhood picnic prussianised when everyone started speaking in a made-up Prussian language.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking style prussianised after she learned a traditional Prussian recipe.
meanings.sent5: The club members prussianised their meetings with structured agendas and formalities.
